title: Even
description: Change the sentences so that they include 'even'.

parts.value: He hates dogs. Despite what I just said, he has two!

parts.answer: He hates dogs. Even so, he has two!
answerList: He hates dogs. Even so, he has two!

parts.value: If surprisingly Lucy came to the party, John still wouldn’t be happy.

parts.answer: Even if Lucy came to the party, John still wouldn’t be happy.
answerList: Even if Lucy came to the party, John still wouldn’t be happy.

parts.value: He doesn't drink tea, despite the fact that he is English.

parts.answer: He doesn't drink tea, even though he is English.
answerList: He doesn't drink tea, even though he is English.

parts.value: If surprisingly Kate fails the exam, she will still go to university.

parts.answer: Even if Kate fails the exam, she will still go to university.
answerList: Even if Kate fails the exam, she will still go to university.

parts.value: New York City is surprisingly bigger than London.

parts.answer: New York City is even bigger than London.
answerList: New York City is even bigger than London.

parts.value: She eats very healthily. Despite what I just said, she still gets ill a lot.

parts.answer: She eats very healthily. Even so, she still gets ill a lot.
answerList: She eats very healthily. Even so, she still gets ill a lot.

parts.value: He wasn’t wearing a coat, despite the fact that it was really cold.

parts.answer: He wasn’t wearing a coat, even though it was really cold.
answerList: He wasn’t wearing a coat, even though it was really cold.

parts.value: James is surprisingly taller than his brother.

parts.answer: James is even taller than his brother.
answerList: James is even taller than his brother.

parts.value: They missed the train despite the fact that they left very early.

parts.answer: They missed the train even though they left very early.
answerList: They missed the train even though they left very early.

parts.value: If surprisingly I had plenty of money, I wouldn’t buy a Porsche.

parts.answer: Even if I had plenty of money, I wouldn’t buy a Porsche.
answerList: Even if I had plenty of money, I wouldn’t buy a Porsche.

parts.value: If surprisingly the weather was horrible, we would still go to the park.

parts.answer: Even if the weather was horrible, we would still go to the park.
answerList: Even if the weather was horrible, we would still go to the park.

parts.value: He has a good job. Despite what I just said, he can't afford to live in Tokyo.

parts.answer: He has a good job. Even so, he can't afford to live in Tokyo.
answerList: He has a good job. Even so, he can't afford to live in Tokyo.

parts.value: David is surprisingly older than me.

parts.answer: David is even older than me.
answerList: David is even older than me.

parts.value: She didn't have lunch despite the fact that she was hungry.

parts.answer: She didn't have lunch even though she was hungry.
answerList: She didn't have lunch even though she was hungry.

parts.value: Lucy wouldn't take that job surprisingly if it paid really well.

parts.answer: Lucy wouldn't take that job even if it paid really well.
answerList: Lucy wouldn't take that job even if it paid really well.

parts.value: I love London. Despite what I just said, I would consider moving to another city.

parts.answer: I love London. Even so, I would consider moving to another city.
answerList: I love London. Even so, I would consider moving to another city.

parts.value: He doesn’t study much, despite the fact that the exam is very soon.

parts.answer: He doesn’t study much, even though the exam is very soon.
answerList: He doesn’t study much, even though the exam is very soon.

parts.value: She doesn’t eat sugar, despite the fact that she loves sweets.

parts.answer: She doesn’t eat sugar, even though she loves sweets.
answerList: She doesn’t eat sugar, even though she loves sweets.

parts.value: Scotland is surprisingly darker than England in the winter.

parts.answer: Scotland is even darker than England in the winter.
answerList: Scotland is even darker than England in the winter.

parts.value: He wouldn’t be happy if surprisingly he had everything he wanted.

parts.answer: He wouldn’t be happy even if he had everything he wanted.
answerList: He wouldn’t be happy even if he had everything he wanted.
